newsitem.title: USA: NY physical coffee - prompt business slows.
newsitem.headline: NY physical coffee - prompt business slows.

text.p: New York physical coffee differentials remained steady in sluggish trade this week, with few prompt sales seen as roasters kept to the sidelines, dealers said.
"Business has been very slow the last two weeks," one dealer said. "Roasters have been waiting for the September position to go into first notice day."

The CSCE spot September contract, which entered notice period on Thursday, surged to its highest level in nearly a year Friday as concern grew about a shortage of coffee available for delivery against September.

Traders said the decline in U.S. certified coffee stocks this week underscored the shortage of nearby supplies. On Monday, the CSCE reported inventories fell 6,259 60-kg bags in the week ended August 16, to 34,516 bags, their lowest levels in 10 years.
"It is probably as tight as it has been and will probably remain tight until November," a dealer said.
With the Brazil's harvest now underway, Brazillian beans continued to fill in for other coffees. But traders said that despite their availability, Brazilian differentials held firm.
